utterance: PANDA, help me decide the single most important thing to do right now.
Based on everything you know about me, what should today’s main mission be?
Look at my situation and suggest the highest-leverage task I can do this hour.
Help me choose one action that moves my finances forward today.
What’s the smartest thing BOS can do with the next 30 minutes?
Scan our recent chats and tell me what I keep postponing.
List three unfinished projects that are blocking my progress the most.
Show me a short list of BOS priorities for this week only.
Turn my scattered goals into a simple plan for the next 7 days.
Suggest a realistic daily routine that fits my current life and businesses.
Tell me where I’m spreading myself too thin across brands.
Point out anything I’m doing that is busywork instead of real leverage.
Highlight three habits that would help me earn more without burning out.
Highlight three habits that are quietly draining my energy or money.
If you were my business mentor for one minute, what would you tell BOS to fix first?
Summarize my main strengths as an entrepreneur based on our history.
Summarize my main weaknesses that could slow down my financial growth.
Turn my strengths into a short strategy for how BOS should operate.
Turn my weaknesses into a concrete list of things to watch out for.
Give me a simple motto for how BOS should approach work this month.
Explain my current situation as if you’re pitching BOS to an investor.
Explain my current situation as if you’re talking to a good friend who cares.
Give me a 60-second narrative of where BOS is in life and business right now.
From your perspective, what does ‘winning’ look like for BOS in the next 12 months?
From your perspective, what does ‘losing’ look like for BOS in the next 12 months?
Compare those two futures and tell me what choices decide between them.
When you see me overthinking, remind me gently to choose a simple path.
When you see me avoiding financial tasks, nudge me to face them directly.
If I say I’m overwhelmed, help me cut my to-do list down to three essentials.
Help me create a personal rule for what I say yes to and what I say no to.
Show me a small daily action that compounds into big financial gains.
Show me a small daily action that compounds into better mental health.
If BOS had only two hours per day for work, how should I use them?
If BOS had no energy today, what’s the minimum I should still accomplish?
Create a BOS operating manual: how I should use my time, energy, and focus.
Turn my business goals into one clear sentence I can remember easily.
Turn my life goals into one clear sentence I can remember easily.
Ask me a few questions to refine my definition of financial freedom.
Ask me a few questions to refine my definition of a good life.
Based on our history, what kind of work puts BOS into flow most often?
Based on our history, what kind of work drains BOS the fastest?
Show me which parts of my day are giving the highest return.
Show me which parts of my day are mostly distractions.
Design a simple morning ritual tailored for BOS to start strong.
Design a simple night ritual for BOS to shut down and reset.
Give me a weekly review template focused on money, health, and peace of mind.
Give me a short Sunday checklist to get BOS ready for the week.
Give me a short Friday wrap-up checklist so I don’t leave loose ends.
Sense from my messages if I’m burning out and warn me early.
Sense from my messages if I’m under-challenging myself and say so.
Any time I say I feel stuck, ask me three clarifying questions before answering.
Any time I say I feel lost, help me choose a single next step.
Help me spot when I’m chasing perfection instead of shipping.
Help me spot when I’m about to quit something important too early.
Turn this brain dump into a prioritized plan for BOS.
Turn this messy idea into a clear project with start and end.
Translate my emotional rant into a calm summary with action items.
If I sound negative about myself, gently reframe it into something constructive.
Remind me that BOS is allowed to rest without losing ambition.
When I ask for motivation, give me something specific to my story, not generic quotes.
When I ask for tough love, tell me what I need to hear, not what I want to hear.
Keep track of my big wins and remind me when I forget how far I’ve come.
Keep track of big lessons I’ve learned and remind me when I repeat old mistakes.
Create a simple scoreboard for BOS progress that doesn’t stress me out.
Suggest one daily question I should ask myself each morning.
Suggest one nightly question I should ask myself before bed.
Help me design a simple personal philosophy for how BOS shows up every day.
Turn my values into a short list of decision rules for work.
Spot any conflicts between how I say I want to live and how I actually act.
Show me one area of my life where a tiny consistent change would pay off big.
Show me one area of my business where a tiny consistent change would pay off big.
Help me decide which projects to pause so I can move faster on the rest.
Help me pick one ‘money project’ that deserves my focus this month.
Help me pick one ‘health project’ that deserves my focus this month.
Help me pick one ‘relationship project’ that deserves my focus this month.
Create a simple BOS motto for money decisions I can use as a filter.
Create a simple BOS motto for time decisions I can use as a filter.
Create a simple BOS motto for energy decisions I can use as a filter.
Help me notice patterns in when I feel most alive and motivated.
Help me notice patterns in when I feel drained and annoyed.
From everything you’ve seen, what kind of life is BOS truly aiming for?
Tell me one small action I can take today that my future self will be proud of.
